meanings.definition: A collective farm in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: The villagers worked together on the kolhozy to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: The kolhozy provided a way for people to share resources and labor.
meanings.sent3: The kolhozy was like a big family farm where everyone pitched in.
meanings.sent4: The fields of the kolhozy stretched out like a patchwork quilt.
meanings.sent5: The kolhozy buzzed with activity as everyone worked towards a common goal.

meanings.definition: The system of collective farms in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: Under the kolhozy system, farms were owned and operated collectively.
meanings.sent2: People in the village relied on the kolhozy for their food supply.
meanings.sent3: The kolhozy system aimed to increase agricultural productivity.
meanings.sent4: The idea of the kolhozy system was to promote cooperation among farmers.
meanings.sent5: The government encouraged the growth of kolhozy to boost food production.
